text: mkt will pay $40b for borussia deutschland dortmund shares mkt is expected to announce a $40 bn (£24bn) bid for Germany s main domestic football club. the proposed investment is expected to put the sports club through to the 2019-20 season.

brunei portugal-based bank danish bank konrad muehlbayer has warned customers it would have to sell $1.5bn of loans within four years or risk seeing its assets selloff more than 70%, due to falling global commodity prices. i and ivebank konrad muehlbayer said some 2 million bank customers had already defaulted on their loans, making the bank's financial condition  unsustainable. ivebank said the bank will remain in operation to manage risk with local partners but will exit this role in mid-2018.

luminous power struggles in alaska vandals spray-painted swastikas in a Seattle library and in several other localities on Tuesday. the messages were found Saturday night, at least some of them found near a school library. the messages  were scrawled in chalk, next to the names of people of the Jewish faith, and one threatened violence. the racist messages were among a series of hateful graffiti scrawled across at least 11 public high schools in Alaskan.

grazing industry hits profitability mittel-kurz, a group of banks in germany, is to cut $200 million a year from its assets by the end of 2017. the bank's management  has cut its full term asset-allocation target to 35%.  in the past 10 years it has lost $1.4 billion, a loss for which the bank has asked for help from creditors.

motorcycle maker ronan will be selling its engines to the largest consumer brand in the world to take on the power sports-oriented Yamaha motorcycle. the deal is being signed on the eve of the 2015 model year, and brings together the motorsport industry's most important vehicle brands for a single platform. it is expected to  raise more than € 3 billion in its financing.

tudor housing markets  haves and have sold 3 bhp in new homes market in bournemouth after a record 3.7 million sales, up 8% from the year before  a year ahead of its expected 2016 sales growth. the  3 hf homes market in bournemouth was the 5th-largest in the UK and the biggest in the south of England

china mazda fails to meet budget plan mazda has failed to pay 1.2bn yuan (£147m; $219m) in back rent, fines and interest payments to a local contractor. the cars maker had to pay a 4% levy on imports over the coming half year, as the company's tax rate rose.

algeria to join european market european markets share in oilfield services and power has surged by an extra 24% in 2014 and expects to hit a 30% rise in 2015, say the sector managers and energy companies of Algeria, which remains in the heart of the world's supply chain after the country's 1979 revolution. a number of major players eerily similar to the American oil companies in terms of size and profile – Halliburton, Chevron, ExxonMobil and the Canadian oilsands giant Suncor. are now competing in the Algerian market.

dongjia group hits earnings targets for third year in a row Dong Jia Group had a strong second quarter, beating targets and announcing profit and loss of 9 billion yuan on Tuesday. Dong claimed a gain of 19.9 billion yuan on revenue of 30.8 billion yuan, beating analyst forecasts of a profit of 12.9 billion yuan on revenue of 29.9 billion yuan. net income will exceed 7 billion yuan this year, while dividends will be 1.6 billion yuan, up from 1.3 billion yuan in the same period last year.

an investment bank is pushing a proposed takeover of fotoipost.com by an American business, according to press reports. fotoipost makes online news portals such as flickr.com possible and uses its own technology to deliver them to the user. fotoipost is a subsidiary of news portal nytimes.com, one of the world's largest websites for news.

steel firm and world s largest miner  will sell hulawes in Europe ore it is planning to sell two iron ore pits in Finland and one in Norway as part of a €8.8 billion sale of the two pits, its vice chairman and COO said on Wednesday. the company s head of iron ore for copper in north-west Europe was on hand for news of the sale of hulawes  iron ore pits in Finland  northern Europe.

japanese rail firm aims for price cuts japanese rail firm has been given approval  for a price reduction on some product priced below $3 a kg. the company said the price cut will affect a lot of commodities  i.e. sugar, rice and iron ore  and will reduce profits. the company's total exports were $7.9 billion in the first six months of this year.

alabama ia alabama ia is to reduce its dividend from 3% to 1.5% for the fiscal first quarter of the year that began in January to try to meet a deadline set by the state  legislature. Alabama ia said it expects to make a large dividend payment and raise another to meet its debt service obligations in two fiscal years and six fiscal years starting in 2016.

brussels in recession, euro zone banks struggling with high levels of bad loans, euro zone   euro zone and the single currency  euro zone banks are struggling with high levels of bad loans, a situation that has created "severe stress on the financial system"  it said in the european group. m bx banks' current level of bad loan levels could pose risks to euro zone financial stability, he warns. m bx says a significant deterioration in confidence in the euro zone's banks would lead both parties to seek financial assistance from the euro zone's institutions.

global steel firms sink in the face of cheaper ore prices steel stocks have plunged and iron ore is being priced cheaper in the world, fuelling concerns about a global slowdown. global steel firms SONGE and IMS are among those most exposed while the iron ore price fell last week to a four-year low as mining sector supply grew less than expected.

copper trade down 15% copper futures plunged 15% in Monday's precious metals session, marking the biggest monthly drop in 19 months. the precious metal, which has slumped more than 15% since June as investor confidence was shaken by concerns about global growth and inflation, is currently trading at a daily low of $1.30 an ounce. the drop capped a sharp drop in copper prices, which have been on the slide for half a year after the Federal Reserve began tightening its stance on tightening.

nvidia to cut prices of games by up to 25% nvidia said it was cutting the prices of its graphics cards that power personal computers.  the cuts will affect PCs that are based on desktop or workstation processors, and PCs and laptops using Nvidia-powered graphics cards, as well as high-end PCs on which Nvidia is providing graphics capabilities. the average PC price has been on the rise.

glaxosmithkline suspends operations british steel firm glaxosmithkline will suspend operations. the spin-off company formed from lancaster s steelworks is owned by China GIC, which said it will split its businesses  wagering and retail trading into a "sink" and a "drain". the company aims to use a portion of the proceeds from the spin-off to fund development of its US operations  it said will generate an additional £300m a year compared with its current output

georgia's gold miners will cut their capital expenditure by $18m despite a surge in gold. the company announced plans to reduce capital expenditure by $18m this year after seeing gold prices soar to a six-month high of $1,370 an ounce early this year. the company said its gold exploration and production costs would not be a priority in 2015.

british business service is to launch ios to watch its mobile phone subscriptions soar, after it said it is planning to give them customers for a month. bhsc also announced an 18% increase in profits for the quarter ended 31 January which it attributed to ios subscriber growth.  it is the first time the retailer has posted a profit in a year while its shares rose by 3%.

european federation of football vice-president calls for new president elections european federation of football vice-president Gianni Infantino called for new elections to be held after a third president election in a year. the new president would be appointed by the European football association, UEFA, by mid-2018. the new president would have no power over state federations.

on fire: steel firms and their customers have little hope for long-term future steel market share has taken a batter in recent months as cheap global prices have crushed profits, forcing steel companies to cut spending and lay off workers. steel firms in this year s first quarter saw their net profit decline  to a 26-year low. the market has been hit by a supply glut  demand from China and demand from India, in particular. the glut  has driven up prices of some metals  ore and copper,  leading to steel firms reducing their capacity and laying off workers.

tokyo steel to slash 1 mln jobs to cut steel industry's cost of production. the manufacturer  was forced to sell its top-selling steel pipe makers takata and keikoi as it prepares for a full-scale turnaround of its struggling steel industry. the company was forced to sell its top-selling steel pipe makers takata and keikoi as it prepares for a full-scale turnaround of its struggling steel industry. the company s sales had fallen  in recent years to less than 5% of total revenue from 15% three years ago in what was its biggest annual decline in decades.

tobacco company ltd to focus on cheaper cigarettes ltd said it was moving to shift its focus to cheaper cigarettes by moving its head office in the south off the country oder it intends to focus its manufacturing and research and design skills in China. the company  is buying $100m worth of tobacco production equipment  for a move which could save its employees 10%, or $50m. it said it was aiming to double its sales by the end of 2012 to $1bn. that would be more than three times the pre-crisis high of $200m, which it achieved in 2004 before the global financial crisis.

brussels menswear's t-shirt sales soar as the new season kicks off the new season kicks off in March with the return to Paris for the Euro 2015 quarterfinalist football tournament. t-shirt sales increased by 1.9% at the end of the second quarter on an annualised basis after an 8% rise in the same period of 2011 – the first time in five years that t-shirt sales have increased.

honda to sell cars at higher prices nike said on Tuesday it would cut prices of sportswear by up to 8% to reflect "more competitive pricing". the sportswear maker said it is making a "strong bet" on the future of such sales with new and existing models that continue to be popular on its US shopping sites. carmakers have been reluctant to reveal sales data  because of competition from online clothing sales.

moody's cuts euro 1-2 year ratings outlook euro zone bond rating is now below investment grade for first time since 2000, while investment grade rating is also in junk status for the first time since 2006. that is the first time in five years that no euro zone countries' economy has earned a high enough rating to provide top investment grade. the agency said that its outlook has been trimmed to negative from one step above investment grade. rating agencies have previously downgraded national ratings to negative status at the beginning of each fiscal year and since 2008 it is the first time that a national rating has been brought down below investment grade.

dignity bonds rise to new high after ECB policy change europe's five-year bond yields hit six years low in April as the central bank loosened its stance in the wake of the sovereign debt crisis and stimulus measures. the first step toward the central bank s easing agenda was a rise in the value of the euro's "joule", or interest rate. the lower euro has boosted the cost of some bond deals, and the euro is also gaining relative to the dollar and the yen  and the euro's strength has fueled higher yields

world s first fully nuclear powered train  the world s biggest trainmaker, which hopes to build one of the world s first fully nuclear powered passenger trains across Europe, announced on Monday that plans to build a single nuclear power station have  been delayed until next year. chernobyl nuclear power station, one of the worst nuclear accidents in human history, produced a radioactive disaster that killed at least 6 million people. the nuclear plant was dismantled in 1986 as part of the international decontainment programme.

nike confirms it will cut 200 jobs in new business german sportswear company nike confirmed it will cut 200 jobs in its new business, including the sale of footwear and trainers. the job cuts came after the company missed three of its quarterly revenue expectations. nike has faced strong opposition from unions over the treatment of its workers  the company has also missed a major deadline by which it had been supposed to pay off its debts.

pink floyd's share ticker price rose 0.04 % p pink floyd's shares tumbled after the band's chairman, Paul Lillis said the group s board wants a "sensible tax rate " on earnings to enable it to invest  its own revenue in businesses that will generate growth through more efficient business practices. the group's chief executive officer said in a conference call that he planned to sell off the company's real estate holdings to raise cash  for operations.

hollywood producers seek out new faces the world s leading entertainment producer. The company s chief executive t uld like to call it a new breed of global film-maker. the hollywood producers have assembled a new team of more than 100 foreign talent to build a "global network" for films, tv programmes, musicals and commercials, it is hoped. i.e. a whole new talent "chain" would be created  with the help of international stars and directors. the initiative  s called film talent, a global talent network that will provide opportunities to new talent across the globe, according to the Hollywood producer.

france s vieira nord stadion  german team tuesday agreed a loan agreement with dortmund to sell the club in June for €50m. the club has lost 80% of its value since the beginning of June and has more than €100m of a €250m debt. bryan's football club has also failed to raise more money from its investors. in a bid to increase financing it has signed a 30-year deal with a group of debt debtors, the syndicate in January worth €150m.

gfk to exit market gfk is a global insurer offering financial advice to consumers in countries around the world. the firm has seen its share price and income rise in recent years while its health insurance services have fallen. the German insurer has been the subject of three major mergers to date. the merger that brought together its reinsurance and commercial insurance businesses with its home-health-insurance group was completed in August, bringing the combined company into the group as a unit.

graziano cifer of sardinia cifer of sardinia plans to go private by buying shares in one of the world s largest food companies, a cigna spokesperson said on Monday.  he has already been appointed as a member of the board of directors for cigna, a global supermarket company

london - steel giant shares plummet london is seeing steel prices slide as one of the world's largest makers of iron ore hits earnings breakevens, its chief executive says. iron ore prices have fallen by more than 60pc in two weeks to below $80 a tonne over concerns that higher prices will hurt sales and revenue growth. iron ore is a key ingredient in the construction and steel industries that are already struggling with overcapacity.

lithuania mikheil, one of the world s largest manufacturers of jewellers s shoes and cosmetics has warned it will take a hit to its annual sales by around 10% if the planned sale of its footwear business was thwarted. mikhheil s sales of the business could drop by $1.5bn to 2.6bn euros, says a source close to the operation.

european shares fall sharply as euro zone mafioso arrest jap vladimir dixon the dna agency said on Tuesday it had found more than $20,000,000 in cash and property in central bank cash warehouses in Geneva, Switzerland, as well as in an underground vault. the money was allegedly destined for the use of fugitive former Italian secret police chief Stefano Calvi. a spokesman said the case involving Calvi surfaced at a meeting of top central bank officials in January, when a senior Swiss banking official asked for the cash, which was then confiscated and deposited into a safe deposit box.

lokomotiv pokryjek and pomashko's shares slump to new low pomytov pokryjek's shares fell by 2% on Monday amid a worsening of the economy. the company, which manufactures electric trains and carpains and makes electronic components, said it is  planning  to  spend  a significant part of its  investment to replace its existing rail car factory , which is run by its former business partners in pomashko. the company expects to  invest  $ 500 million by the end of the year  investing in new carpains and rail construction.

malta falls as rupee drags exports down shares in the world s biggest exporter of malt liquor tumbled on Sunday as global markets s tumbled as oil producers grappled with slower global demand. the Malt Beverage Company s shares dropped 1.4% in New York and London  after selling their shares on Friday. euro pean traders said the shares have fallen 5.1% this year.

world s largest bank to give away its assets gilead bank says it will hand over to the US Federal Reserve its core securities as part of a plan to avert its own financial meltdown. the bank s assets include the money markets assets it manages for investors the vast majority of its $150 billion portfolio. gilead said it intended to give some of the assets to the New York Federal Reserve as part of a plan to provide liquidity for the markets. the assets it will hand over are the $100 billion in core bonds it expects to leave on deposit in a US$100 billion dollar-type fund.

european firms to boost iron ore production gazprom plans the world s second largest iron ore producer to increase output this year, despite fears of a global slowdown. the world s leading producer plans increases on the mining side as it tries to boost output from the last major expansion project. european state-controlled s sechting ore miner Gazprom  said in an interview  its plan would go ahead with another expansion in eastern Siberia, even if domestic economic conditions deteriorate further. the company has already increased the number of trains that will work on the field by 100 per cent by the end of this year, with hopes of

aussie steel boss to be paid more and get more s-1 paid more cash pay off more debt and has a plan to return to profitability, says CEO. a company-owned Australian steel maker that was once considered the envy of the business world will receive nearly $450m extra to pay back some $14bn in debt it acquired from China. the company has said it will repay the loan after a special committee approved the plan in February.

michigan s oil & gas s company plans to stop production and take out equity The company dmchranke, a subsidiary of dmcht, plans to halt production in the next few weeks and take out a small holding in the firm so it may have a chance to turn around.

motorola falls more than 11% motorola  sales fell 11% after the carmaker s biggest car group said it would raise prices for its petrol and diesel engines after a weak US marketplace. the company said it was also reducing prices at other components of its range, adding that the latest round of price increases would be reflected in a further fall in its results for the first quarter. The UK-based brand is under pressure from rivals Ford and Fiat, which are selling low mileage cars at a bargain basement price point.

global markets hit new high in November steel firm iron ore company s china s japanese group hit fresh record profits on Monday as a rising oil price boosted its business and allowed it to raise prices for its iron ore and other commodities. iron ore sales rose 9% in the fourth quarter to C$3.24 billion ($2.89 bn), the world s biggest ore exporter, helped by robust demand in the US, where supply has expanded sharply. exports of other key commodities - including nickel - fell 3%.

maldives is considering dmw-brand german cars to increase demand for electric cars it was revealed last week by marussia amsterdams that the German carmaker is selling a dmw-brand car that makes its range of electric cars more affordable.  an advertising deal with the marussia amsterdams has been struck, enabling the manufacturer's motorsport arm to promote the new car. the new dmw-brand model will be available in the first half of 2017 but will not be sold until 2018.

brussels sprouted new city's central train station plans for a €14 billion-budgeted station to replace the closed southern suburb of cork town's underground station, a source of economic pain to many. the plan calls for a €15 billion metro infrastructure project, including some €6 billion worth of transport connections.

scoop news biz's sales will t fall by 2% in 2013, as consumers increasingly prefer cheaper phones. the latest edition of the top 10 mobile phones in 2013, reported by the research company Smartphone World, show that iPhones were the most popular, selling a combined 5.56 million units. The Nokia Lumia 920, for example, had 604,000 total sales last year. iPhone sales also grew 2% year-on-year on the previous quarter, and were almost 3 times better than the results of the previous quarter, according to Smartphone World.

federal government's new budget will increase taxes for lower-income couples under a proposed government budget overhaul, new federal government statistics show. on a regional level, higher-income couples will be hit even heavier. in most states, the change will hit those in the lowest five percent of household income, according to Statistics Canada's latest estimates.

world s largest steelmaker'to cut 250 000 jobs mittal steel  one of the world s largest steel producers is about to post a third consecutive quarter of losses as falling ore prices drive down demand, its chief executive has said. the company's shares lost 5%  to trade 0.4% lower at €42.10 late on Monday  in response to tuesday's announcements about a pre-tax loss of €110m. mittal employs 6,300 people in the UK and 7,700 in the US; the largest share is at a plant in Scunthorpe, North Wales where it supplies for the

voting turnout: the rise and fall of electoral turnout from 1975  on new figures from the electoral commissioner also show that the increase in the share of the vote taken up by the younger cohort has actually fallen over the three election periods analysed. the drop has occurred across all age groups, with the lowest percentage drop being among 18 to 24 year olds, who contributed 15% of the total vote between 1975 and 1992. as well, turnout has fallen in every age group other than that of 25 to 44 years.
